docs.lead_paragraph: While Moses Malone was settling his contract differences with the Spirits of St. Louis yesterday, National Basketball Association players and owners were planning to return to the bargaining table today in an effort to reach an out-of-court settlement of the Oscar Robertson law suit.

docs.snippet: A top-level meeting will be held tomorrow in New York in an attempt to reach an out-of-court settlement of the Oscar Robertson law suit....
docs.lead_paragraph: A top-level meeting will be held tomorrow in New York in an attempt to reach an out-of-court settlement of the Oscar Robertson law suit.
docs.abstract: Top-level meeting will be held on Jan 7, NYC, in attempt to reach out-of-ct settlement of Oscar Robertson law suit, which was instituted in '70 by Robertson on behalf of NBA players and contends that common draft, option clause and NBA equivalent of football's 'Rozelle rule,' which compensates team a player has left to sign with another, violate antitrust laws; owner and player reprs listed (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: My eye was caught recently by an item in one of the Hollywood gossip columns. Right after the latest news about Cher's most recent annulment from Greg Allman (I think the grounds this time were irreconcilable hair-do's) was the following dispatch: "Michael Caine goes next into 'Hollywood and Vine' playing Jackie Gleason's son."
